content: before purling the next st p 1 more st on the 1st needle in round 3 round 3 first st is already done p1 in cc continue with the second one * p1 in cc p1 in mc * repeat always bring the yarn to the opposite direction when purling this round need more help → https //youtu be/xi1zbcrutdo heel flap 32 sts row 1 sl1 *k 1 cc k1 mc* repeat to the last st hold the yarn together and k1 row 2 sl1 * p 1 cc p1 mc* repeat to the last st hold the yarn together and p1 repeat the 2 row adjusting the heel flap is key to making socks fit comfortably especially for high insteps or narrow feet knit the heel until it forms a square if you have a higher instep you can add extra row too make the heel flap shorter for narrow feet always try on after the heel turn finish the heel flap on the ws turning the heel mc work with short row starting on the rs knit to the exact centre of the heel flap row 1 rs k1 ssk k1 turn row 2 ws sl1 p3 p2 tg p1 turn row 3 rs sl1 k until you get to 1 st before the gap ssk k1 turn row 4 ws sl1 p until you get 1 st before the gap p2 tg p1 turn repeat row 3-4 until you have all your sts used up make your last decrease on the ws knit across on the rs and start working the gusset gusset mc pick up sts on the left side of the heel flap as many sts as many v shaped edge sts you find knit across the instep pick up sts on the other side of the heel flap the sole is worked in stockinette/ stocking st you have to decrease your newly picked up sts on the side needles make two decreases in each decreasing round before the instep and after the instep until you have your original number of sts left leaning decreases ssk right leaning decreases k2 tg if you have a narrow feet decrease in the first and third rounds knit the second and the fourth rounds without decreasing then decrease in each round -3- if you have a wide feet or high instep decrease in every other round you can even decrease less frequently if you want to create more room in the gusset instep pattern left cable right cabele → https //youtu be/p0cb7mxsmxo start from the bottom right hand corner read the chart from right to left and upwards one row at a time repeat the pattern 4 times on the instep -4- instep pattern round 1 * k4 p1 1/1 lc p1 * repeat 4 times round 2 * k4 p1 1/1 rc p1 * repeat 4 times round 3 * k4 p1 1/1 lc p1 * repeat 4 times round 4 * k4 p1 1/1 rc p1
